Description: Wall fragment of Attic black-figured pottery semi-open vase, perhaps a stamnos; interior reserved with a broad black band; exterior: black-figure decoration: to right lower part of nude male to right, extending right arm and leg; to left possible traces of similar figure facing the opposite direction (heel, buttocks and left elbow). Simple groundline in dilute glaze.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.2202)
